Package com.elle.cellularautomata

Class CellAuto2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.elle.cellularautomata.CellAuto2D
  • public class CellAuto2D
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for a cellular automaton that keeps track of its previous generations and hence has two dimensions, time (rows) and space (columns). This generation-tracking allows for coarse-graining of the cellular automata throughout time.

                  int numgens,

        Parameters:
        rule - for cellular automaton in decimal, 0-255 (inclusive)
        numgens - number of generations
        numcells - cells per generation

      • CellAuto2D

        public CellAuto2D()
        Alternate constructor. Default rule of 110 with 333 cells/gen for 333 gens.

      • rules

        public int rules​(int a,
                 int b,
                 int c)
        Determines death/survival of individual cell based off internal rule
        Parameters:
        a - left cell
        b - current cell (middle)
        c - right cell
        Returns:
        0 or 1 (death or survival of b cell)

      • coarseGrain

        public void coarseGrain()
        Performs coarse-grain via tuplet majority rules; e.g. if the original cells are [1,1,0,1,0,0] the coarse-grain is [1,0] because the first 3 cells are majority 1 and the second 3 are maj. 0 If cells/gen is fewer than 3 it will not coarse-grain

      • multiGrains

        public void multiGrains​(int grains)
        Performs given number of coarse-grains on cells
        Parameters:
        grains - number of coarse-grains to be performed If grains input is 0, no coarse-grain will be performed

      • countCellsAlive

        public int[] countCellsAlive()
        Returns:
        array showing number of cells "alive" (in the 1 state) per generation, where generation is index

      • display

        public void display()
        prints all cell states in CellAuto2D

      • displayInfo

        public void displayInfo()
        prints CellAuto2D information
